AD_CaretakerChatter.synopsis: Humming and saying things to himself - main purpose is to make players easier to spot him.
AD_CaretakerChatter.how_to_trigger: Caretaker is playing this dialog automatically, repeated over time.

AD_TeletrapTriggered.synopsis: The hatchery guard spots a player in the cage that the teleportation traps put people in.
AD_TeletrapTriggered.how_to_trigger: Trigger a teleportation trap in the hatchery.

TouchWarning.synopsis: The caretaker warns the player to leave the egg. If it is repeated, he starts a fight.
TouchWarning.how_to_trigger: Set if you interact with the egg and the caretaker sees you. Or if he spots you while the Egg dialog is ongoing.

AD_CaretakerCombat.synopsis: Combat voice bark in the first turn of combat in the Creche hatchery.

Egg.synopsis: The player inspects the egg, having never seen anything like it before. In addition to taking or destroying it, they can do a variety of other odd things with the egg - including commune with the unborn gith inside.
Egg.how_to_trigger: Interacts with the unhatched egg in the hatchery.

PAD_HatcheryComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react toentering deeper into the hatchery. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_HatcheryComment.how_to_trigger: load up CRE_Main_Ago to 1293; 1; -772the AD will play

Caretaker.synopsis: The gith caretaker asks what the player is doing in the hatchery. They can learn some interesting lore about githyanki eggs. The player can also convince the caretaker to give them the last unhatched egg - but he is quite attached to it.
Caretaker.how_to_trigger: Use Debug Book to travel to Act 1b -> Creche - Main Creche floorGet through the dialog with the guards at the checkpoint (you'll likely need to use killcombat in recon)Once through the doors go left (west), then right (north), and enter the Hatchery Chamber through the door at the end of the corridor.Head north and jump across the rocks in the acid.  Speak to the caretaker standing at the top of a large rocky outcrop.

NearEggWarning.synopsis: The caretaker warns the player to not touch the egg.
NearEggWarning.how_to_trigger: Get seen near the egg in the Hatchery without permission. If you have received permission, this does not play at all.

Guard.synopsis: A male gith guard, watching over the hatchery where gith eggs are hatched. He's a caustic personality, ready to kill anyone who touches the lone egg in the hatchery.
Guard.how_to_trigger: Use Debug Book to travel to Act 1b -> Creche - Main Creche floorGet through the dialog with the guards at the checkpoint (you'll likely need to use killcombat in recon)Once through the doors go left (west), then right (north), and enter the Hatchery Chamber through the door at the end of the corridor.Speak to the guard to the right (north) as you enter the room - he's standing at the edge of the pool beside a pillar.

AD_CaretakerEnterCombat.how_to_trigger: Plays if combat with the caretaker starts.

PAD_EnteredGas.synopsis: The player is affected by the strange fumes in the hatchery surrounding the egg (actually gith pheromones). To non-gith, they stink and weaken you slightly (gain status to make you more vulnerable to physical damage). To gith characters, they're actually quite pleasant and make you feel tougher (status gives you resistence to physical damage boost).
PAD_EnteredGas.how_to_trigger: When the player first steps into the hatchery, which is filed with gith pheromone fumes.Use Debug Book to travel to Act 1b -> Creche - Main Creche floorGet through the dialog with the guards at the checkpoint (you'll likely need to use killcombat in recon)Once through the doors go left (west), then right (north), and enter the Hatchery Chamber through the door at the end of the corridor.

automatic_ordering.reasoning:
After reviewing the synopsis and trigger descriptions, several ordering and exclusiveness relationships become apparent. First, some sessions trigger immediately upon entering the hatchery. For instance, PAD_EnteredGas plays as soon as the player steps in and should occur before other interactions such as the environment comments triggered later in deep–hatchery (PAD_HatcheryComment). When the player interacts with or even approaches the egg without the proper permission, two sequences can occur: one branch is where the player simply inspects the egg (Egg) and then, if the caretaker notices or if the player repeats the interaction improperly, the caretaker issues a warning (TouchWarning). Repeated or provocative egg interactions further escalate the situation into combat: the initial combat voice bark (AD_CaretakerCombat) and then the subsequent combat trigger as soon as the fight actually begins (AD_CaretakerEnterCombat). In addition, there is a mutual exclusiveness relationship surrounding the egg interactions. If the player speaks with the caretaker (the 'Caretaker' session), they may obtain permission to inspect or interact with the egg. In that case the warnings for approaching or touching the egg (NearEggWarning) are not triggered. This means that the caretaker session and the near egg warning session should not both appear in the same playthrough path. Other sessions such as AD_CaretakerChatter, AD_TeletrapTriggered, and Guard are more ambient or situational and do not have strict ordering or exclusiveness constraints with the ones focused on egg interaction and combat escalation. Therefore, the ordering rules that are identified are:
1. PAD_EnteredGas must trigger before PAD_HatcheryComment (since the former happens immediately on entry and the latter when entering deeper).
2. Egg must come before TouchWarning, because the warning is a consequence of interacting with the egg without permission or proper caution.
3. TouchWarning must come before AD_CaretakerCombat, since the warning escalation leads to the combat dialogue.
4. AD_CaretakerCombat must come before AD_CaretakerEnterCombat, as the combat-related voice lines progress from the initial bark to the engagement phase.
In terms of exclusiveness, the caretaker conversation (Caretaker) provides permission for interacting with the egg which prevents the triggering of the NearEggWarning session. Thus, both sessions should not occur during the same journey.

The following JSON reflects these ordering and exclusivity constraints.

AD_CaretakerChatter_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_CaretakerChatter_0.text: Come on little one, come on now - it's time to come out.
AD_CaretakerChatter_0.context: NodeContext: spoken fondly to an unhatched egg

AD_CaretakerChatter_1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_CaretakerChatter_1.text: Don't you want to fight with your brothers and sisters?
AD_CaretakerChatter_1.context: NodeContext: encouragingly, to an unhatched egg - like encouraging a child to go play

AD_CaretakerChatter_3.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_CaretakerChatter_3.text: Fighting a battle already, and it's not even born yet...

AD_TeletrapTriggered_3.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
AD_TeletrapTriggered_3.text: Intruders! You will regret defiling this place.

AD_TeletrapTriggered_4.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
AD_TeletrapTriggered_4.text: To arms! The traps have snagged a rat.
AD_TeletrapTriggered_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The Player has activated a trap

AD_TeletrapTriggered_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_TeletrapTriggered_0.text: Stand down. They have my permission to proceed.
AD_TeletrapTriggered_0.context: NodeContext: Giving an order to a soldier about to attack the player

AD_TeletrapTriggered_1.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
AD_TeletrapTriggered_1.text: Very well, sir. As you say.
AD_TeletrapTriggered_1.context: NodeContext: Thinks his boss's order is wrong, but obeys, almost with gritted teeth.

AD_TeletrapTriggered_2.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_TeletrapTriggered_2.text: Defend the hatchery - kill the intruders!

TouchWarning_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
TouchWarning_0.text: Do not touch the egg! This is your final warning, k'chakhi.

TouchWarning_1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
TouchWarning_1.text: I told you not to touch the egg - this foolishness ends here.
TouchWarning_1.context: NodeContext: Aggressive; he's about to forcefully expel the player from the hatchery (with violence)

AD_CaretakerCombat_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_CaretakerCombat_0.text: Pa'vrylk! Violator! You will not leave my hatchery alive.

Egg_4.speaker: Narrator
Egg_4.text: *A large green egg with an uneven shell.*

Egg_16.speaker: Narrator
Egg_16.text: *You can see a vague outline of something within it.*
Egg_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the very alien-looking egg - enough to make your skin crawl JUST a little

Egg_18.speaker: Player
Egg_18.text: Reach out and touch the egg.

Egg_12.speaker: Narrator
Egg_12.text: *The egg is warm to the touch, the rough shell like slate beneath your fingers.*
Egg_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player crouches and reaches out to touch the egg cautiously.

Egg_11.speaker: Narrator
Egg_11.text: *Whatever is within is stirring ever so slightly.*
Egg_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player returns to their original standing position.

Egg_15.speaker: Player
Egg_15.text: Pick it up gingerly and stow it in your pack.

Egg_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Picking up the egg itself takes place in gameplay

Egg_1.speaker: Player
Egg_1.text: Crush the egg beneath your foot.

Egg_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player lifts their foot and brings it down hard, smashing the egg to pieces. We see the VFX with the egg offscreen, similar to CRA_Escape_Mindflayer

Egg_5.speaker: Lae'zel
Egg_5.text: By Vlaakith's blade, what devil's got hold of you, that you'd slay an unborn?!

Egg_9.speaker: Shadowheart
Egg_9.text: Hells, was that really necessary? You almost got hatchling on me.
Egg_9.context: NodeContext: Annoyed. (player just smashed a gith egg)

Egg_2.speaker: Karlach
Egg_2.text: Whoa! What in the Hells is wrong with you?!

Egg_17.speaker: Astarion
Egg_17.text: It's all over your foot! Oh that's disgusting.
Egg_17.context: NodeContext: Astarion just watched the player smash a gith egg with their foot.

Egg_6.speaker: Wyll
Egg_6.text: Damn - you showed that egg who's boss. A real hero.

Egg_14.speaker: Gale
Egg_14.text: Right then. I do understand the rule about omelets and breaking eggs, but when there's more embryo than yolk involved... Well, ew.

Egg_7.speaker: Narrator
Egg_7.text: *A fine githyanki egg. At least on the outside.*

PAD_HatcheryComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HatcheryComment_0.text: Gods, it smells awful in here.

Caretaker_3.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_3.text: I don't have time to parent you as well. What do you want now?

Caretaker_12.speaker: Player
Caretaker_12.text: You're being very protective of this egg - why?

Caretaker_92.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_92.text: It's taking a little longer than expected to hatch.
Caretaker_92.context: InternalNodeContext: He doesn't want to let on how big a deal this is, but it's not a good sign. Not good at all.

Caretaker_6.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_6.text: The conditions must not be disturbed if it is to have a fighting chance.

Caretaker_114.speaker: Player
Caretaker_114.text: I want the egg. How much for it?

Caretaker_80.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_80.text: Is this some sort of grotesque attempt at humour?

Caretaker_94.speaker: Player
Caretaker_94.text: Our broods are bigger than this, kin. Where are the others?

Caretaker_111.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_111.text: An accurate assessment. They hatched promptly and are well into their training.

Caretaker_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_0.text: This one is just proving slow.

Caretaker_100.speaker: Player
Caretaker_100.text: This egg would do better away from the tyranny of our kind. Give it to me and I'll give it a better life.

Caretaker_21.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_21.text: Careful, kin. You tread close to blasphemy. Do not overstep.

Caretaker_4.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_4.text: An egg. You murdered a defenceless egg!

Caretaker_11.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_11.text: You will pay for this. Htak'a!
Caretaker_11.context: NodeContext: quivering with rage [huh-tack-AH =  a battle cry meaning "attack!"]

Caretaker_28.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_28.text: This hatchery is a place of solemn duty and care. No one approaches an egg without my permission.
Caretaker_28.context: NodeContext: You caught the player trying to get close to your precious egg.

Caretaker_112.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_112.text: Of course, a stranger from a strange crèche may have different customs. What brings you here?

Caretaker_37.speaker: Player
Caretaker_37.text: I am here to help you save the egg.

Caretaker_117.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_117.text: This egg is in my care. It does not need saving.

Caretaker_1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_1.text: It is a little slower to hatch, nothing more.

Caretaker_120.speaker: Lae'zel
Caretaker_120.text: Failure at the first hurdle of existence. Most caretakers would crush it and be done.

Caretaker_99.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_99.text: Most caretakers would not give the child its fair chance, but I shall. There could be greatness in that shell.

Caretaker_46.speaker: Narrator
Caretaker_46.text: *You note that the hope in his voice is tinged with weariness. It's the voice of a man who's fought the inevitable for a long time.*

Caretaker_36.speaker: Player
Caretaker_36.text: Tell me the truth. Why do you really care about this one so much?

Caretaker_59.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_59.text: Not all that arrive late are weak. I created this entire hatchery, despite being the last of my clutch to hatch.
Caretaker_59.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

Caretaker_20.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_20.text: They almost drowned me in the hatching pool. If it wasn't for the varsh of my clutch -
Caretaker_20.context: InternalNodeContext: He trails off, thinking of how lucky he was.

Caretaker_77.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_77.text: This one deserves the same chance.
Caretaker_77.context: InternalNodeContext: He catches himself mid-sentimental-moment and resumes his more professional air.

Caretaker_47.speaker: Player
Caretaker_47.text: What will happen to this egg if it doesn't hatch?

Caretaker_49.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_49.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn will give orders to destroy it. She will say it's a weakling.
Caretaker_49.context: NodeContext: Hesistant; he doesn't want to destroy the egg

Caretaker_73.speaker: Player
Caretaker_73.text: This seems like an awful lot of fuss for one egg.

Caretaker_35.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_35.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn is of the same opinion. She would see it destroyed and forgotten.

Caretaker_124.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_124.text: I'll give it a while longer, and if it doesn't hatch - it will have proven her right.
Caretaker_124.context: InternalNodeContext: He desperately wants this egg to hatch, even though he knows it probably won't.

Caretaker_7.speaker: Player
Caretaker_7.text: Why bother? This egg's clearly a dud.

Caretaker_63.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_63.text: That is for me to decide.

Caretaker_18.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_18.text: Time for you to leave, I think, kin. And do not touch the egg.

Caretaker_65.speaker: Player
Caretaker_65.text: Why risk its life at all? Give it to me - I'll take care of it.

Caretaker_67.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_67.text: You? You've no varsh instincts about you at all.

Caretaker_90.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_90.text: Still, the captain's due for an inspection any day now, and if she sees it here...
Caretaker_90.context: InternalNodeContext: He's torn by this decision, an impossible decision. NodeContext: the captain will destroy his precious egg if she finds it

Caretaker_42.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_42.text: Tell me, what will you do with it if I entrust it to you?

Caretaker_15.speaker: Player
Caretaker_15.text: I'll raise it as if it were my own flesh and blood.

Caretaker_58.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_58.text: Hm. Just beware that adoptive piety does not turn to sentimentality.

Caretaker_66.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_66.text: Though it could be the only way this one reaches adulthood, I fear.

Caretaker_13.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_13.text: Still, I'm sure it's nature will pervade, even if raised among lesser species.
Caretaker_13.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

Caretaker_104.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_104.text: I can no longer ignore that Kith'rak Therezzyn's patience has its limits.

Caretaker_81.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_81.text: Very well. Here - take these - they will aid you approach the egg.

Caretaker_122.speaker: Player
Caretaker_122.text: I'll make the best omelette you've ever tasted.

Caretaker_9.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_9.context: NodeContext: Forceful response to "I'm gonna turn your egg into an omlette." Combat starts afterwards

Caretaker_23.speaker: Player
Caretaker_23.text: I'll see that it becomes the greatest ghaik-slayer you've ever seen.

Caretaker_127.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_127.text: Not an easy task. And far harder without a crèche to train it in.

Caretaker_43.speaker: Player
Caretaker_43.text: I'll find another crèche. One that's more forgiving.

Caretaker_64.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_64.text: Do you think the Sword Coast is littered with crèches? That you found this one was unlikely enough.

Caretaker_33.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_33.text: But you've a spirit about you that's quite inspiring. Perhaps even equal to the challenge.

Caretaker_25.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_25.text: Unlikely, but the journey may yet be character-forming.

Caretaker_82.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_82.text: I do this under protest. But it is what's best.

Caretaker_44.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_44.text: Just know that if the child comes to harm, I will find you, drag you back here, and drown you in the burning waters.
Caretaker_44.context: NodeContext: Reluctant to hand over the egg; a threat through gritted teeth

Caretaker_50.speaker: Player
Caretaker_50.text: Depends, how much do you think these things sell for?

Caretaker_107.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_107.context: NodeContext: Player just said they'd sell your egg. Combat follows.

Caretaker_79.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_79.text: You? What do you know about githyanki child-rearing?

Caretaker_57.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_57.text: No! The child will be safer with me. I know what it needs.

Caretaker_16.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_16.text: This is my duty. I will protect it.
Caretaker_16.context: InternalNodeContext: He doesn't really believe himself - the captain will have his neck for this, but it's an unspoken sacrifice he's prepared to make. NodeContext: Stress "I"

Caretaker_8.speaker: Player
Caretaker_8.text: You're out of time and clearly stalling - that's why Kith'rak Therezzyn sent me to bring it to her. Hand it over.

Caretaker_14.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_14.text: I see. I cannot deny that I had hoped for more time.

Caretaker_96.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_96.text: But the kith'rak speaks for our Queen. And I live to serve. Fine. You can take it.

Caretaker_103.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_103.text: It would certainly be her style to send a messenger in her stead for a task like that.

Caretaker_102.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_102.text: If she really wants it, she can come and get it herself.

Caretaker_97.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_97.text: But if I know her, she's too busy for that.

Caretaker_126.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_126.text: An istik? Don't make me laugh.

Caretaker_123.speaker: Player
Caretaker_123.text: You're wasting time. Give it to me now or I'll tell her you're the weakling.

Caretaker_10.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_10.text: You think I haven't defended our broods against worthier opponents than you? Idiot.
Caretaker_10.context: NodeContext: Incredulous; you dare challenge one as experienced as him?

Caretaker_72.speaker: Player
Caretaker_72.text: Let me help - I can take it somewhere safe.

Caretaker_85.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_85.text: I do not midwife the birth of your young - do not tell me how to care for mine.
Caretaker_85.context: NodeContext: Irritated at the player's probing

Caretaker_118.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_118.text: It is a dangerous world out there - I'm sure you know that.

Caretaker_93.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_93.text: We cannot afford to discard warriors because we are simply impatient.

Caretaker_53.speaker: Player
Caretaker_53.text: Why do you care so much about one dud egg?

Caretaker_62.speaker: Player
Caretaker_62.text: I wanted to see the hatchery. I didn't expect it to look so empty.

Caretaker_68.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_68.text: Almost all of the eggs in this clutch have hatched. We await only one more, which is... taking its time.

Caretaker_45.speaker: Player
Caretaker_45.text: I am curious about the egg you guard.

Caretaker_83.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_83.text: There is little to be curious about. It is taking its time hatching, nothing more.

Caretaker_115.speaker: Player
Caretaker_115.text: I came here to steal an egg.

Caretaker_27.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_27.text: How dare you? Your bones will melt in the hatching pool, you insolent whelp!
Caretaker_27.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'dare'. Combat starts after this line.

Caretaker_54.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_54.text: Still, I suppose a guest in our crèche can be allowed some understanding. What brings you to my hatchery?

Caretaker_55.speaker: Player
Caretaker_55.text: I heard you're waiting for one last egg to hatch.

Caretaker_87.speaker: Player
Caretaker_87.text: You mistook me for someone. Who were you expecting?

Caretaker_110.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_110.text: Someone with orders from our commander to destroy this egg.

Caretaker_70.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_70.text: You can tell Kith'rak Therezzyn that my position has not changed: the egg requires more time. Furthermore - oh.
Caretaker_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Starts the dialog facing directly away from the player. Turns on 'Furthermore'NodeContext: You turn on 'Furthermore' expecting to see an angry guard, but you're surprised to find the player - a complete stranger.

Caretaker_74.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_74.text: You are not from Crèche Y'llek. What are you doing here?

Caretaker_119.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_119.text: I was not expecting an istik. What brings you to my hatchery?

Caretaker_88.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_88.text: Well? Will you take the egg or not?

Caretaker_98.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_98.text: Did you think me a fool? Did you think I wouldn't notice the theft of our final egg?

Caretaker_113.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
Caretaker_113.text: You've got the egg haven't you? Be on your way then. Before I change my mind.
Caretaker_113.context: InternalNodeContext: He gave us permission to take it, but is sad to see it go nonetheless, and masking this with terseness.

NearEggWarning_0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
NearEggWarning_0.text: Do not think you can take liberties because you are kin - stay away from the egg.
NearEggWarning_0.context: NodeContext: Getting annoyed now, a little aggressive; protective of the egg

NearEggWarning_1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
NearEggWarning_1.text: Istik, I will not warn you again - get away from the egg.
NearEggWarning_1.context: NodeContext: Aggressive, protective of the egg; great emphasis on "get away from the egg"

NearEggWarning_2.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
NearEggWarning_2.text: It is forbidden to approach the egg, kin. You will respect our rules.
NearEggWarning_2.context: NodeContext: Urgent, a little aggressive; protective of the egg

NearEggWarning_3.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
NearEggWarning_3.text: Do not approach the egg, istik! It is strictly forbidden.

Guard_5.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nods at the player in greetingNodeContext: Curt greeting

Guard_7.speaker: Player
Guard_7.text: I'd like to speak to the caretaker.

Guard_29.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_29.text: You will find Varsh Ko'kuu watching over his clutch of one.

Guard_21.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_21.text: Follow the rocks through the acid, but do not approach the egg.

Guard_6.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_6.text: Watch your feet. Our hatchery does not treat strangers kindly.

Guard_17.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_17.context: NodeContext: Could throw in a derisive snort or grunt at the end. You don't think much of this decision.

Guard_18.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_18.text: Step carefully, kin. Our hatchery is protected by lethal safeguards - I would hate to see you fall foul of them.

Guard_24.speaker: Player
Guard_24.text: Hatchery? Where are all the eggs?

Guard_1.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_1.text: Hatched, mostly. Only one remains unbroken, watched over by Varsh Ko'kuu, caretaker of our young.

Guard_10.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_10.text: You may speak to him if you wish, but do not approach the egg. Lest you fall foul of me.

Guard_22.speaker: Player
Guard_22.text: So how can I avoid these traps?

Guard_3.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_3.text: Traps are not built to be avoided. Varsh Ko'kuu designed every one himself, elegantly crafting this room to protect our young.

Guard_13.speaker: Player
Guard_13.text: Why is the water that colour?

Guard_28.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_28.text: Water? Our young are not born to water - it is a burning acid.

Guard_9.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_9.text: Varsh Ko'kuu designed this hatchery to be the perfect birthing place for our warriors: impenetrable to our enemies.

Guard_20.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_20.text: The hatchery is a dangerous place to linger, kin.

Guard_23.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_23.text: Istik are permitted to view the birthing pools now? These are strange times.

Guard_2.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_2.text: Step carefully while here. Our hatchery is protected by lethal safeguards. I do not wish to pick your remains from them.

Guard_26.speaker: Player
Guard_26.text: I thought a hatchery would have more eggs?

Guard_27.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_27.text: Most are hatched. Only one remains, monitored by Varsh Ko'kuu, the caretaker of our young.

Guard_8.speaker: Player
Guard_8.text: You could point out the traps? I'd definitely avoid them then.

Guard_15.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_15.text: You may speak to the Varsh if you wish, but stay away from the egg. There will be no second warning.

Guard_25.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard_25.text: And do not approach the egg! That would be a transgression too far.

AD_CaretakerEnterCombat_1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_CaretakerEnterCombat_1.text: I'll make you wish you'd never been born!

PAD_EnteredGas_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredGas_0.text: What is that stink? It's making my head spin.
